013package org.apache.juneau.objecttools;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017
018import java.lang.reflect.*;
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
023
024/**
025 * POJO model sorter.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 *    This class is designed to sort arrays and collections of maps or beans.
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
032 * <p class='bjava'>
033 *    MyBean[] <jv>arrayOfBeans</jv> = ...;
034 *    ObjectSorter <jv>sorter</jv> = ObjectSorter.<jsm>create</jsm>();
035 *
036 *    <jc>// Returns a list of beans sorted accordingly.</jc>
037 *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>result</jv> = <jv>sorter</jv>.run(<jv>arrayOfBeans</jv>, <js>"foo,bar-"</js>);
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 *    The tool can be used against the following data types:
041 * </p>
042 * <ul>
043 *    <li>Arrays/collections of maps or beans.
044 * </ul>
045 * <p>
046 *    The arguments are a simple comma-delimited list of property names optionally suffixed with <js>'+'</js> and <js>'-'</js> to
047 *    denote ascending/descending order.
048 * </p>
049 *
050 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
051 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ObjectTools">Object Tools</a>
052
053 * </ul>
054 */
055@SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
056public final class ObjectSorter implements ObjectTool<SortArgs> {
057
058   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
059   // Static
060   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
061
062   /**
063    * Default reusable searcher.
064    */
065   public static final ObjectSorter DEFAULT = new ObjectSorter();
066
067   /**
068    * Static creator.
069    *
070    * @return A new {@link ObjectSorter} object.
071    */
072   public static ObjectSorter create() {
073      return new ObjectSorter();
074   }
075
076   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
077   // Instance
078   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
079
080   /**
081    * Convenience method for executing the sorter.
082    *
083    * @param <R> The return type.
084    * @param input The input.
085    * @param sortArgs The sort arguments.  See {@link SortArgs} for format.
086    * @return A list of maps/beans matching the
087    */
088   public <R> List<R> run(Object input, String sortArgs) {
089      Object r = run(BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION, input, SortArgs.create(sortArgs));
090      if (r instanceof List)
091         return (List<R>)r;
092      if (r instanceof Collection)
093         return new ArrayList<R>((Collection)r);
094      if (isArray(r))
095         return Arrays.asList((R[])r);
096      return null;
097   }
098
099   @Override /* ObjectTool */
100   public Object run(BeanSession session, Object input, SortArgs args) {
101      if (input == null)
102         return null;
103
104      // If sort or view isn't empty, then we need to make sure that all entries in the
105      // list are maps.
106      Map<String,Boolean> sort = args.getSort();
107
108      if (sort.isEmpty())
109         return input;
110
111      ClassMeta type = session.getClassMetaForObject(input);
112
113      if (! type.isCollectionOrArray())
114         return input;
115
116      ArrayList<SortEntry> l = null;
117
118      if (type.isArray()) {
119         int size = Array.getLength(input);
120         l = Utils.listOfSize(size);
121         for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
122            l.add(new SortEntry(session, Array.get(input, i)));
123      } else /* isCollection() */ {
124         Collection c = (Collection)input;
125         l = Utils.listOfSize(c.size());
126         List<SortEntry> l2 = l;
127         c.forEach(x -> l2.add(new SortEntry(session, x)));
128      }
129
130      // We reverse the list and sort last to first.
131      List<String> columns = listFrom(sort.keySet());
132      Collections.reverse(columns);
133
134      List<SortEntry> l3 = l;
135      columns.forEach(c -> {
136         final boolean isDesc = sort.get(c);
137         l3.forEach(se -> se.setSort(c, isDesc));
138         Collections.sort(l3);
139      });
140
141      List<Object> l2 = Utils.listOfSize(l.size());
142      l.forEach(x -> l2.add(x.o));
143
144      return l2;
145   }
146
147   private static class SortEntry implements Comparable {
148      Object o;
149      ClassMeta<?> cm;
150      BeanSession bs;
151
152      Object sortVal;
153      boolean isDesc;
154
155      SortEntry(BeanSession bs, Object o) {
156         this.o = o;
157         this.bs = bs;
158         this.cm = bs.getClassMetaForObject(o);
159      }
160
161      void setSort(String sortCol, boolean isDesc) {
162         this.isDesc = isDesc;
163
164         if (cm == null)
165            sortVal = null;
166         else if (cm.isMap())
167            sortVal = ((Map)o).get(sortCol);
168         else if (cm.isBean())
169            sortVal = bs.toBeanMap(o).get(sortCol);
170         else
171            sortVal = null;
172      }
173
174      @Override
175      public int compareTo(Object o) {
176         if (isDesc)
177            return Utils.compare(((SortEntry)o).sortVal, this.sortVal);
178         return Utils.compare(this.sortVal, ((SortEntry)o).sortVal);
179      }
180   }
181}
